comments.body: Let the chests remain. But the old bookshelves need to be replaced with new ones.

I gotta say to keep both. Library chests carry other book related loot that can't be placed in a chiseled bookshelf. I still like the bookshelves we have now, and replacing ALL of them would either have far too much loot, or too many empty shelves.
It would be really cool to see a maze-like library in the stronghold, rather than the structure we have now.
That would be nice because the new bookshelves look so cool.

^No, replacing all the shelves will not result in a lot of loot if the average number of books per shelf is 3, like the old bookshelf. In addition, an old library should not look complete, because silverfish in real life can eat paper from books. And part of the books would be with the READERS. And another part of the shelf space would be a reserve.

Great idea
They should still spawn naturally in forests but you should be able to find them more frequently here
mud should be flameproof, and should slow you down
I suppose it would make sense if mud couldn't catch on fire and slowed you down, but maybe not as much as soulsand slows you down.

Mud? Mud Bricks? Ancient Cities?

:)
Cool idea! Like an Ocean Ruin on land (And maybe made of wood)

Awesome! I think this should be in the game. This would give a sense of civilization in the world beyond the villages and such. Also, I think there should be more advanced civilization than what we have so far.
I like it but i will make lesss rare and spawn anywere but swamps and Jungles

Yes this is an awesome idea. No offense to the devs but fossils currently suck in-game. If they actually had structure beyond ‚Äúrib cage‚Äù and ‚Äúpillar of bone‚Äù and instead they could actually look like huge skulls or smthng, maybe even horns... *sigh* it would be amazing
Great idea! I hope that it gets added

I can just visualize a giant tower blending within the ice spikes, The Iceologer confined within his room, poring over it's books, whilst our brave adventurer, STEVE, finds himself straying through the cold land of ice...

I think something like a Witch Hut would work.

 

The need some kind of home we can find up there... and take over.
Iceologer lost
I like this idea, because I miss the old villages. I also think they are better. The new villages are small inside.
What do I do with this trident your adding?
Good idea I like it.
this would be a great idea
No i don't think it makes sense Netherite is a nether ore it should be found in the Nether
No. I think a more end themed material would be appropriate.

You can still get netherite from bastions, but only ingots, scraps, and ancient debris. Besides, I strongly disagree. Having netherite generate in End cities would ruin one of the biggest reasons to go to the Nether, which is the antithesis of the Nether Update.

I think netherite should be added to end cities, just make them like the rarest loot you can get from a chest or something. Prior to 1.16, the cities had END game loot (enchanted diamond armor, tools, golden apples, etc.) or loot that was clearly meant to be valuable. This makes sense obviously because this is the END of minecraft. I personally got a full set of netherite armor before I killed the dragon, but because of the armor I had, most of the end city loot (which is supposed to be end game, OP loot) was boring to me. I only cared about getting an elytra at that point. While I understand minecraft wants netherite to be nether exclusive to make players spend time in the nether, it makes no sense that netherite wouldn't be able to be found in end cities. And for those who say that netherite scraps/ancient debris is nether exclusive, diamonds gold iron are found in the end cities, aren't they overworld exclusive? Again, I think netherite/debris and netherite gear should be extremely (most likely the rarest) loot one can find in end city loot chests. It gives those players who've achieved netherite more of an incentive to explore the end cities which was intended for players with good tools/armor to explore prior to 1.16.
With this update they need to get ride of Curse of Vanishing loot in the End! its the End and your so exited to get super good gear... BUT ITS A CURSE!? that's not fair at all.

medalbeard99099

You got curse of vanishing end loot? Oof.
this is way to OP
Smart words from an wise man/woman
This makes a lot of sense, but it might be a bit OP.
These should be craftable. I'm thinking a pattern of stone and redstone in specific patterns.

I think it would be more interesting to make them variants of chiselled stone and sandstone in strongholds, ocean ruins, and desert temples. (players probably built them judging by the undead that can be found there)

I also think that if they were cave paintings they should be made with dye rather than Redstone, or they should have Redstone functionality.

They could work like omnidirectional redstone wire and conduct redstone current through/up walls.

Now that a cave update has been announced that also adds archeology, cave paintings seem like a very obvious feature to have.

The problem is that the clay pots they showed off are interactive, but cave paintings seem harder to be made 'interactable'. Maybe some system to be able to make cave paintings yourself ?
Airplanes do not fit the theme of Minecraft.  This would not be a good addition.

william miller its a good edition like better stuff you cannot just be noting also its kida hard for notch to make minecraft and its hard cause its only 1 person working on minecraft um notch needs workers cause updates are too slow
Absolutely not terrible idea
Delete this idea

good idea
A cool follow up to this would be to add biome specific archaeological finds.
Very trueeeee,a armor trim,a sniffer new seed of white pumpkin, and new pottery shard or a halloween tematic disc will be very cool
The dig site could be covered in pale moss carpet and really hard to spot during the day, but include glowing blocks under the moss, to encourage spooky night-time digs.
This could also tie into the lore of the ancient builders that came before us and their mysterious ways. The desert being home to Temples and Wells, what was in the desert they were so interested in?
This is a good idea
This could open up for more curses in the future to have more corresponding bleasings

I think that the idea of turning cursed items into some kind of blessed item (or even simply removing the curse) is great!

Instead of just using a well though, I think that this "discovery" by the ancient builders would have had big consequences (maybe people getting curses on purpose to get blessings after a trip to the well?) and would have been a little more gatekept. Why not in a secret room in the Desert Temple or the Jungle Temple?
Cool!
Makes sense. Should've been added sooner.

Now that we have archeology in the works and a new Cherry Grove biome, this type of structure would fit extremely well into 1.20, especially if updated to contain some Cherry Grove things and a bit of quasi-lore from the archeology style loot, that could be found here. No written records or at least none that are legible, but the place should be able to seem like it is telling a story of ancient times, somewhere within or just past the timeframe of the underground ancient cities being taken over by sculk.
minecraft really needs a structure update.

Can I add some things? I think there should be more like ruins of old temples or whatever scattered across the world with unique patterns and build styles. Have unique loot, treasure maps, stories written in books that lead you to certain locations with more loot, so on so forth. Think you all get the idea.

This is a great idea :)
Great idea!!
Good but not the sculk growth. If you want to get that the deep dark is the place. You have to go to the deep dark to get that.

Great idea! Currently, the game has very few underground structures for exploration, challenge, and loot (usually just mineshafts). Huge underground cities give off such a spooky vibe, it fits well in the game, especially with archaeology. It could also have more challenging new mobs, like the unused Illusioner, or better-equipped mobs like zombies wearing full iron armor and sword/shield.
I would love to see thin in game especially if it was a village full of witches and if you like the idea of having new villages with new adventures pleas check out my post. Voted!

This sounds like it could be a part of a potential cave update. When I imagine this place I also imagine lots of little waterfalls and pools, as well as stalagmites.
